meanings.definition: A person who violates a law or rule.
meanings.sent1: The violator was caught stealing from the store.
meanings.sent2: The police officer arrested the violator for speeding.
meanings.sent3: The violator tried to sneak past the security guard but got caught.
meanings.sent4: The violator of the no-smoking policy was fined heavily.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reminded the students that being a violator of the classroom rules would have consequences.

meanings.definition: Something that violates a law or rule.
meanings.sent1: The graffiti on the wall was considered a violator of public property.
meanings.sent2: The broken lock was a violator of the security protocol.
meanings.sent3: The loud music from the party was a violator of the neighbor's peace and quiet.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing trash can was a violator of the cleanliness standards.
meanings.sent5: The unauthorized access to the computer system was a violator of company policy.
